intro: Xanthocephalum microcephalum, commonly known as the small-headed goldenhead, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Xanthocephalum microcephalum is adapted to tolerate saline and arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
